intro: Lindera flavinervia, commonly known as the yellow-veined ligustrum, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes other aromatic plants like avocado and cinnamon. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in clusters and are followed by small, dark berries. Lindera flavinervia is often found in moist woodlands and thrives in partial to full shade.
